meanings.definition: A short poem or prose piece depicting a peaceful, idealized rural scene.
meanings.sent1: The poet wrote an idyl about the beautiful countryside.
meanings.sent2: The idyl painted a serene picture of the farm at sunset.
meanings.sent3: Reading the idyl made everyone long for a peaceful retreat in nature.
meanings.sent4: Her words wove an idyl that transported the reader to a tranquil meadow.
meanings.sent5: The idyl's description of the babbling brook was so vivid, it felt like being there.

meanings.definition: A simple and pleasant experience or situation.
meanings.sent1: Their picnic by the lake was a true idyl of relaxation and joy.
meanings.sent2: The idyl of spending a lazy afternoon with friends brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent3: Finding a parking spot right in front of the store was an unexpected idyl.
meanings.sent4: The idyl of a perfect day off work felt like a dream come true.
meanings.sent5: The idyl of a warm cup of tea on a rainy day was all she needed to feel content.
